tit.cmt: 京福のサイトより、Kitano-Hakubaicho としました。

sen.j: 北野白梅町駅（きたのはくばいちょうえき）は、京都市北区 (京都市)下白梅町にある京福電気鉄道北野線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Shimohakubai-cho, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kitano Hakubaicho Station is a stop on the Kitano Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Kitano Hakubaicho Station, located in Shimohakubai-cho, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kitano Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Kitano-Hakubaicho Station, located in Shimohakubai-cho, Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kitano Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 京福のサイトより、Kitano-Hakubaicho としました。(Kyoto City) を追加しました。

sen.j: 駅ナンバリングはB9。
sen.e: Its station number is B9.
Its station number is B9.
Its station number is B9.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 頭端式3面2線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is an aboveground station which has a toothed platform with 3 teeth and 2 tracks.
It is an aboveground station having a toothed platform with three teeth and two tracks.
It is an aboveground station having three toothed platforms and two tracks.

sen.j: 乗車は中央のホームから行う。
sen.e: Boarding trains is performed at the center platform.
Trains are boarded from the center platform.
Trains are boarded from the center platform.

sen.j: 降車は両端のホームへ行うことが多い。
sen.e: Existing trains is mainly performed at either the right or the left platform.
Trains are generally exited at either the right or the left platform.
Trains are generally exited at either the right or the left platform.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: イズミヤ白梅町店 - 駅南側すぐ
sen.e: Izumiya Hakubai-cho Branch: On the right south side of the station
Izumiya Hakubai-cho Branch: On the right (south) side of the station
Izumiya Hakubai-cho Branch: On the right (south) side of the station

sen.j: 北野天満宮 東へ500m
sen.e: Kitano Tenmangu Shrine: 500m to the east
Kitano Tenmangu Shrine is located 500 meters to the east.
Kitano Tenmangu Shrine is located 500 meters to the east.

sen.j: 天神川 (京都市)
sen.e: Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City)
Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City)
Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City)

sen.j: 洛星中学校・高等学校
sen.e: Rakusei Junior and Senior High School
Rakusei Junior and Senior High School
Rakusei Junior and Senior High School

sen.j: 京都大将軍郵便局
sen.e: Kyoto Taishogun Post Office
The Kyoto Taishogun post office
The Kyoto Taishogun post office

sen.j: 西大路通と今出川通の交差点上にある。
sen.e: There is a bus stop at the intersection of the Nishioji-dori Street and the Imadegawa-dori street.
There is a bus stop at the intersection of Nishioji-dori and Imadegawa-dori streets.
There is a bus stop at the intersection of Nishioji-dori and Imadegawa-dori streets.

sen.j: 京都市営バスと西日本ジェイアールバスでバス停名が異なる。
sen.e: The bus stop is called differently for buses operated by Kyoto City Bus and West JR Bus Company.
Kyoto City Bus and West JR Bus Company both use the stop, but they refer to it by different names.
Kyoto City Bus and West JR Bus Company both use the stop, but they refer to it by different names.

sen.j: 北野白梅町
sen.e: Kitano-hakubai-cho
Kitano-hakubai-cho
Kitano-hakubai-cho

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 北野
sen.e: Kitano
Kitano
Kitano

sen.j: 西日本ジェイアールバス
sen.e: West JR Bus Company
West JR Bus Company
West JR Bus Company

sen.j: 京都駅行／栂尾・周山行
sen.e: For Kyoto Station and for Toganoo/Shuzan
For Kyoto Station and for Toganoo/Shuzan
For Kyoto Station/for Toganoo and Shuzan
sen.cmt: スラッシュを追加しました。

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）11月3日 京都電燈によって北野～高雄口間が開業。
sen.e: November 3, 1925: The section between Kitano and Takao-guchi was opened to traffic by Kyoto Dento, an electric power corporation.
November 3, 1925: The section between Kitano and Takao-guchi was opened to traffic by Kyoto Dento, an electric power corporation.
November 3, 1925: The section between Kitano and Takaoguchi was opened to traffic by Kyoto Dento, an electric power company.
sen.cmt: electric power company としました。

sen.j: 京都市電白梅町停留所設置の後、白梅町駅として開業。
sen.e: After Hakubaicho Bus Stop was set up by Kyoto City Trams, it started its operation as Hakubaicho Station.
After Hakubaicho Bus Stop was set up by Kyoto City Trams, it started operating as Hakubaicho Station.
After Hakubaicho Stop was set up by Kyoto City Trams, it started operating as Hakubaicho Station.
sen.cmt: 市電の駅ですので、Busは削除しました。

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）9月16日 京都市電今出川線の延伸に伴い、北野～白梅町間は京都市電に路線を譲渡する形で廃止。
sen.e: September 16, 1958: With the expansion of the Imadegawa Line of Kyoto City Trams, the operation between Kitano and Hakubai-cho was transferred to Kyoto City Trams and thus discontinued.
September 16, 1958: With the expansion of the Imadegawa Line of Kyoto City Trams, the operation between Kitano and Hakubai-cho was transferred to Kyoto City Trams and thus discontinued.
September 16, 1958: With the expansion of the Imadegawa Line of Kyoto City Trams, the operation between Kitano and Hakubaicho was transferred to Kyoto City Trams and thus discontinued.

sen.j: 北野白梅町駅に改称。
sen.e: The station changed its name to Kitano Hakubaicho Station.
The name was changed to Kitano Hakubaicho Station.
The name was changed to Kitano-Hakubaicho Station.

sen.j: 終着駅となる。
sen.e: It became a terminal.
It became a terminal.
It became a terminal.

sen.j: 京都市電西大路線・京都市電今出川線
sen.e: Kyoto City Trams Nishioji Line and Imadegawa Line
Kyoto City Trams Nishioji Line and Imadegawa Line
Kyoto City Trams Nishioji Line and Imadegawa Line

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道
sen.e: Keifuku Electric Railroad

sen.j: 北野白梅町駅 B9 - 等持院駅 B8
sen.e: Kitano Hakubaicho Station B9 - Tojiin Station B8
Kitano Hakubaicho Station B9 - Tojiin Station B8
